intro: Cyphostemma montanum, commonly known as the Mountain Cyphostemma, is a climbing plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asclepiadaceae and is characterized by its thin, woody stems and opposite, elliptical leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in umbels, followed by follicles containing seeds. It thrives in rocky and arid environments, often growing on cliffs or among shrubs. Due to its unique appearance and adaptability, it is sometimes cultivated for ornamental purposes.
